line_1: "Before her spells young ARNO'S bloom decays,
line_2: " And fierce on me th' infernal poison preys. "

line_1: The violet pale, the blushing red decays,
line_2: Nor drops prismatic break the falling rays,

line_1: The artist's labour mellows or decays.
line_2: Under his sliding course of hours and days
And health that gilds our days,

line_1: Which first inspir'd the flame, decays.
line_2: But lives, when that exterior grace

line_1: We muse, and mark the sad decays
line_2: Of mighty works, and mighty days!

line_1: Your friendly Flame admits of no Decays;
line_2: But glows, unclouded, with augmented Rays,

line_1: Your friendly Flame admits of no Decays;
line_2: And makes your bridal Lamp much brighter blaze.

line_1: And at the touch each flattered form decays.
line_2: On common life, romance's tints she lays;

line_1: And saith, 'tis inward Grief, your Youth decays.
line_2: Whilst your Physitian, the true Cause displays,

line_1: " And shew how all by slow degrees decays;
line_2: "T' instruct the children in his Maker's ways,

line_1: In weakness pleas'd, and smiling thro' decays,
line_2: On her lov'd child behold the mother gaze,

line_1: See how I droop! my strength decays,
line_2: And life wears out a thousand ways;

line_1: (Tho' each may feel Increases and Decays,
line_2: And see now clearer and now darker Days)

line_1: So Life but opens now, and now decays:
line_2: So vanishes our State: so pass our Days:

line_1: By Heaven and you my Life blooms or decays,
line_2: You point my wane or my encrease of days;

line_1: If the taste sickens, or our frame decays.
line_2: Eden in vain immortal sweets displays,
